sub_title: Corporate Trainee at Royal Schiphol Group
summary:
Hello, my name is Sanne, and on this account I'd like to keep you updated on my professional career in the aviation industry. 

In September 2022 I started as a Corporate Trainee at Royal Schiphol Group. In two years, I work on five different projects throughout the several departments at Amsterdam Airport Schiphol. During the weekends I am an active glider pilot and flight instructor.

education.field_of_study: International Baccalaureate, English Language and Literature

awards.title: Most punctual team
awards.description: In 2012 I was a representative for the Netherlands in the International Mathematics Competition in Taipei, Taiwan. Our team won an honorary award for most punctual team.

awards.title: Winner Dutch selection - Taiwan International Mathematics Competition 2012
awards.description: After several rounds of mathematical competitions in the Netherlands I was one of the eight selected high school students to represent the Netherlands at the Taiwan International Mathematics Competition in the summer of 2012.

projects.title: Guest author for Clingendael's Silk Road Headlines
projects.description:
China’s New Silk Road initiative, also known as ‘One Belt, One Road’ (OBOR), is aimed at enhancing connectivity between China, Eurasia and Africa. This ambitious undertaking carries major geopolitical implications. The New Silk Road initiative brings along important new challenges and opportunities for Europe, Asia, and Africa. Silk Road Headlines provides you with a weekly overview of news articles from open sources relating to China's initiative, its consequences, and international responses.

https://www.clingendael.org/publication/silk-road-headlines

contributors.headline: Corporate Trainee at Royal Schiphol Group

projects.title: MIRAI Japan's Friendship Ties programs
projects.description:
In 2015, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan has launched “Japan’s Friendship Ties Programs”,
which promote people-to-people exchanges between Japan and the various nations of the Asia-Pacific,
North America, Europe, Caucasus, Central Asia, Latin America, and the Caribbean, to encourage an
understanding of Japan’s economy, society, history, diverse culture, politics, and diplomatic relations
among participants. In 2022, 121 students and young professionals were invited to participate in the program. I travelled to Tokyo and Hiroshima as part of the program in February 2023.

projects.description: The exciting summer program will gather a group of aspiring young professionals and advanced university students from around the European continent. The summer school focusing on the challenges of EU-China relations will take place on May 27-30, 2022, in the beautiful UNESCO World Heritage town of Kutná Hora, Czech Republic, near the capital Prague.

projects.title: Study Association Sirius:  Chairman Career Committee
projects.description: As part of the Career Committee of my study association in Twente I organised several career-related activities, such as lunch-lectures, a CV photoshoot, a business case and a LinkedIn check.

projects.title: Eurosim: EU-simulation game in New York
projects.description: Eurosim is a European Union Simulation Conference that aims at broadening knowledge of the EU of both American and European university students. At this conference I had the honour to chair one of the committees. I helped the delegates with their proposals and led the debates.

contributors.headline: Corporate Trainee at Royal Schiphol Group

projects.title: International Air Cadet Exchange: Australia and France
projects.description: The International Air Cadet Exchange Association has the purpose of planning and running an annual, world-wide exchange for aviation-minded young people each July. Each year 500 young people are given the opportunity to expand their horizons, experience different cultures and make life-long friendships. In 2015 I represented the Netherlands in Australia, and in 2016 I represented the Netherlands in France.

contributors.headline: Corporate Trainee at Royal Schiphol Group

projects.title: Lorentz Model United Nations Organising Committee
projects.description: LmunA is a conference of three days at which high school students will engage in a simulation of the United Nations. The conference is run and organized by students and I was part of the Organizing Committee twice: as Head of Finance and Sponsoring in 2013 and Head of Catering in 2014.

projects.description: Together with seven Dutch high school students I represented the Netherlands during the International Mathematics Competititon in Taipei in 2012. It was an honour to be able to represent my country. This experience showed me that by working hard for your study, great opportunities lie ahead.

profile_positions.description:
Five assignments at different departments within Royal Schiphol Group:

1. Drafting a Roadmap for the Safe Energy Transition at the department Fire Brigade, Crisis & Safety Training (October 2022 - January 2023) 
2. Working on the steps towards Zero Emission Airside Operations at the departments Strategy & Airport Planning and Asset Management (February 2023 - May 2023)
3. Continuing the business development and portfolio management in Asia and Australia for Schiphol International (June 2023 - November 2023)
profile_positions.title: Corporate Trainee

profile_positions.description: The Flevum Board of Directors (Corporate) program offers CEO’s, COO’s and CFO’s of medium-sized and large organisations a view on current trends and developments that influence the management of the organisation. I am responsible for the speaker line-up for our periodic Executive Board meetings. Also, I write and publish interviews with different executives.
profile_positions.title: Staff Member Executive Program

profile_positions.description: Clingendael - the Netherlands Institute of International Relations - is an independent think tank and academy on international affairs, based in The Hague. During my internship at the Clingendael China Centre I conducted my own research on decentral diplomacy. To be specific, I wrote about sister city relations between Dutch and Chinese municipalities. Besides this, I contributed to other Clingendael research on technological cooperation with China, dependencies on China and effective EU foreign policy towards China. Lastly, I was responsible for two newsletters: the Silk Road Headlines and the China Finance Focus.
profile_positions.title: Intern Clingendael China Centre

company.name: Consulate General of the Netherlands in Chongqing

profile_positions.company: Consulate General of the Netherlands in Chongqing
profile_positions.description: In this internship I supported the activities of the Economic Department of the Consulate General in Chongqing. This Consulate General is responsible for promoting Dutch businesses and entrepreneurship in Chongqing, Sichuan, Shaanxi, Yunnan, and Guizhou.
profile_positions.title: Economic Affairs Trainee

profile_positions.description: As a faculty coordinator for Marketing & Communication I am responsible for organising the open days for the bachelor and master studies of the faculty BMS (Behavioral, Management & Social Sciences). Next to that, I am responsible for setting up student-for-a-day days for these study programmes.
profile_positions.title: Faculty Coordinator Marketing & Communication

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the promotion of the Netherlands-Asia Honours Summer School at the University of Twente.
profile_positions.title: Ambassador

profile_positions.description: I am very happy to be part of the 100 Dutch students selected for this program. The Netherlands-Asia Honours Summer School aims at strengthening the relation between Asia and the Netherlands. In the summer of 2018 I will travel to Chengdu to work on a project for a Dutch company. Next to that, I will follow courses at Sichuan University. The last part of the trip will be spent in Shanghai with a business- and cultureweek.

profile_positions.description: As a Sandwich Artist I greeted and served guests, prepared food, maintained food safety and sanitation standards, and handled and processed light paperwork. Also, I delivered sandwiches in and around Arnhem.

Guanxi is a Dutch platform connecting entrepreneurs doing business in China. In monthly China Cafe's different guest speakers discuss the ins and outs of current business topics. As a Team Member, I help organise these China Cafe's by setting up the logistics and welcoming the visitors. During the China Cafe's I meet people working in the field that I would like to work in after finishing my university degree.
